original: @223b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @223b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: mam ga la aashta ka ;
analyzed: mam ga la aashta ka ;
translated: Mangalāṣṭaka

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: bkra shis brgyad pa /
analyzed: bkra shis brgyad pa /
translated: The Eight Auspicious Symbols

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'jam pa'i dpal dang 'jig rten mgon po rgyal ba mchog gi cod pan dang ni dzambha la //
analyzed: 'jam pa'i dpal dang 'jig rten mgon po rgyal ba mchog gi cod pan dang ni dzambha la //
translated: Mañjuśrī, Lokanātha, Jayottara, Jina, Jambhala,

original: rdor sems byams pa phyag na rdo rje lag na autpal bzang skyong dang ni sgra gcan 'dzin //
analyzed: rdor sems byams pa phyag na rdo rje lag na autpal bzang skyong dang ni sgra gcan 'dzin //
translated: Vajrasattva, Maitreya, Vajrapāṇi, Utpalapāṇi, Bhadrapāla, and Rāhula,

original: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs sa gsum phyag rgyas nyes pa ma lus zad gyur pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam par snang mdzad la sogs sa gsum phyag rgyas nyes pa ma lus zad gyur pa //
translated: Buddha Vairocana, and so forth, the three worlds, sealed with the destruction of all faults without exception,

original: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: May the joyful ones grant you the auspiciousness of accomplishing all aims with a stainless and blissful mind.

original: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyugs bdag 'dul byed rdo rje dril bu padma'i lag pa can dang @224a * //
analyzed: rdo rje h'um mdzad phyugs bdag 'dul byed rdo rje dril bu padma'i lag pa can dang @224a * //
translated: Vajrahūṃkāra, Paśupati, Vajrāṇu, Ghaṇṭāpaṇi, Padmapāṇi,

original: ni ; / ha l'a ha l'a ser po dag dang dgra yi tshogs 'joms dakki'i rgyal po bdag nyid che //
analyzed: ni ; / ha l'a ha l'a ser po dag dang dgra yi tshogs 'joms dakki'i rgyal po bdag nyid che //
translated: Halāhala, and Pīta, the great being Daṇḍarāja, the conqueror of the hordes of enemies,

original: mi bskyod pa dang spos kyi glang po rin chen tog dang rab 'jigs mi g-yog shin rje'i dgra //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa dang spos kyi glang po rin chen tog dang rab 'jigs mi g-yog shin rje'i dgra //
translated: Akṣobhya, Gandhahastin, Ratnaketu, Ugra, Acalā, and Viśālakarmā,

original: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: may the auspiciousness of the fulfillment of all aims with a stainless and blissful mind be bestowed upon you, O joyful ones.

original: yon tan tshogs mnga' byang chub sems kyis sems brgyan dge 'dun 'jig rten gsum gyis phyag byas dang // dga' ba rab grub sangs rgyas rtsod pa'i dri ma las rgyal he ru ka dang dbyig sngon can //
analyzed: yon tan tshogs mnga' byang chub sems kyis sems brgyan dge 'dun 'jig rten gsum gyis phyag byas dang // dga' ba rab grub sangs rgyas rtsod pa'i dri ma las rgyal he ru ka dang dbyig sngon can //
translated: Endowed with a host of qualities, adorned with the mind of enlightenment, the Saṅgha, revered in the three worlds, and the one who accomplishes great joy, the Buddha, victorious over the stains of dispute, Heruka and Nīladaṇḍa,

original: sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po rgyal po rgyal ba'i yon rigs sems can kun la rjes brtse ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas s'a la'i dbang po rgyal po rgyal ba'i yon rigs sems can kun la rjes brtse ba //
translated: the Buddha, the lord of the Sāla tree, the king, the victor, the one with a lineage of victors, compassionate towards all sentient beings,

original: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: may the auspiciousness of the fulfillment of all aims with a stainless and blissful mind be bestowed upon you, O joyful ones.

original: shes rab skul byed sgrol ma dag dang ye shes tshogs ni bsags par gyur pa'i khro gnyer can //
analyzed: shes rab skul byed sgrol ma dag dang ye shes tshogs ni bsags par gyur pa'i khro gnyer can //
translated: Prajñā, Ārabhya, Tārā, and the one who accumulates wisdom, Bhṛkuṭī,

original: bdud kyi bdud gyur 'od zer can ma zhal gsum mdog ser 'jigs pa mtha' dag rab 'joms ma //
analyzed: bdud kyi bdud gyur 'od zer can ma zhal gsum mdog ser 'jigs pa mtha' dag rab 'joms ma //
translated: Māmakī, with three faces, yellow, the demon of demons, the light-ray-bearer, the total conqueror of all fears.

original: rma bya chen mo m'a ma k'i dang dgra yi tshogs 'joms gos dkar mo dang sangs rgyas spyan //
analyzed: rma bya chen mo m'a ma k'i dang dgra yi tshogs 'joms gos dkar mo dang sangs rgyas spyan //
translated: Mahāmāyūrī, Māmakī, the conqueror of hosts of enemies, Pāṇḍaravāsinī, Buddhalocanā,

original: dgyes ma rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes ma rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: the delighted ones, grant you the auspiciousness of the accomplishment of all aims, with stainless mental bliss.

original: gandha ri dang lag na ltos 'gro zhags pa lcags kyu ral gri 'dzin byed dug sel ma //
analyzed: gandha ri dang lag na ltos 'gro zhags pa lcags kyu ral gri 'dzin byed dug sel ma //
translated: Gandharī, Lakṣmī, Pāśī, Āṅkuśī, Khadgī, Saṃharṣiṇī,

original: rdo rje lag pa ma dang phag mo dgra sta ral gri 'dzin byed chos kyi dbang phyug ma //
analyzed: rdo rje lag pa ma dang phag mo dgra sta ral gri 'dzin byed chos kyi dbang phyug ma //
translated: Vajrapāṇi, Vārāhī, Daṇḍī, Khadgī, Dhūmāvatī,

original: bde mchog las byung ye shes dpa' bo dpung rgyan phyag drug rgyal mtshan rab tu 'chang byed pa //
analyzed: bde mchog las byung ye shes dpa' bo dpung rgyan phyag drug rgyal mtshan rab tu 'chang byed pa //
translated: the heroes arisen from Cakrasaṃvara, the armlet-wearer, the six-armed one, the banner-bearer,

original: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: the delighted ones, grant you the auspiciousness of the accomplishment of all aims, with stainless mental bliss.

original: rgyal ba mchod byed pi wang phreng ma glu ma dang ni ri khrod bdug spos rdo rje ma //🔽ro langs mar me dri yi rdo rje rab tu bzhad gdong bde 'gro dag dang mi pham ma //
analyzed: rgyal ba mchod byed pi wang phreng ma glu ma dang ni ri khrod bdug spos rdo rje ma // ro langs mar me dri yi rdo rje rab tu bzhad gdong bde 'gro dag dang mi pham ma //
translated: The Victorious One is worshipped by the women of the lute, the garland, and the song, and by the women of the hermitage, the incense, and the vajra.🔽The zombie, the lamp, the perfume, the vajra, the one with a smiling face, the one who goes to happiness, and the one who is invincible.🔽

original: sangs rgyas byang chub dpal mo dang ni rgyal ba mtha' dag mnyes par byed pa'i dbyangs can ma ;🔽/ dgyes ma rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //🔽rgyal ba mchog gis chos 'khor bskor gyur yangs pa can dang bya rgod phung po'i ri bo dang // lum bi ni dang mnyan yod dang ni sa yi steng gnas ko ka med dang byang @224b chub shing //🔽dpal gyi be'u dang aa shad 'dab ma zhol 'bras me tog dpal 'bras dung dang 'khor lo can //
analyzed: sangs rgyas byang chub dpal mo dang ni rgyal ba mtha' dag mnyes par byed pa'i dbyangs can ma ;🔽/ dgyes ma rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //🔽rgyal ba mchog gis chos 'khor bskor gyur yangs pa can dang bya rgod phung po'i ri bo dang // lum bi ni dang mnyan yod dang ni sa yi steng gnas ko ka med dang byang @224b chub shing //🔽dpal gyi be'u dang aa shad 'dab ma zhol 'bras me tog dpal 'bras dung dang 'khor lo can //

original: dgyes pa rnams kyi dri med yid de don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyi dri med yid de don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: May the stainless mind of the delighted ones grant you the auspicious accomplishment of all aims.

original: gdugs dang d'ur ba padma dang ni rgyal mtshan dag dang nya dang bi wang sil snyan 'dzin //
analyzed: gdugs dang d'ur ba padma dang ni rgyal mtshan dag dang nya dang bi wang sil snyan 'dzin //
translated: Holding parasols, fly whisks, lotuses, victory banners, fish, lutes, and cymbals,

original: pheg pa dag dang rab gang bum pa thub pa gsung mchog rdo rje dril bu'i sgra dang ni //
analyzed: pheg pa dag dang rab gang bum pa thub pa gsung mchog rdo rje dril bu'i sgra dang ni //
translated: Bells, and vases filled with nectar, the sound of the vajra and bell of the supreme speech of the Sage,

original: sangs rgyas cho 'phrul 'jo sgeg bzhad 'gros rnam par rol pa lha dang mi yis phyag byas pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas cho 'phrul 'jo sgeg bzhad 'gros rnam par rol pa lha dang mi yis phyag byas pa //
translated: The Buddha's magical displays, graceful movements, and laughter, worshipped by gods and humans,

original: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
analyzed: dgyes pa rnams kyis dri med yid bde don kun grub pa'i bkra shis khyod la stsal du gsol //
translated: May the stainless mind of the delighted ones grant you the auspicious accomplishment of all aims.

original: rje btsun 'phags ma sgrol mas gsungs pa'i bkra shis brgyad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rje btsun 'phags ma sgrol mas gsungs pa'i bkra shis brgyad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The eight auspicious verses spoken by the noble Tara are complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi na ya shr'i mi tra dang / lo ts'a ba ldan ma tshul khrims seng ges bsgyur ba'o//
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po bi na ya shr'i mi tra dang / lo ts'a ba ldan ma tshul khrims seng ges bsgyur ba'o//
translated: Translated by the Indian abbot Vinayashrimitra and the Tibetan translator Denma Tsultrim Senge.
